result.execSummary:
The defendant Chloe Anne Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chloe Anne Steele is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chloe Anne Steele was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Chloe Anne Steele was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation by 5/23/22 at 12:00 PM.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 Court Costs. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- AODA within 30 days and follow through with recommendations.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with L.B. Subject to modification by Agent.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Follow through with any other recommendations re: counseling, treatment, etc.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
- Pay supervision fees.

02:59 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Christianson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jens Hubert Loberg, DF: Chloe Anne Steele appeared. Includes 22CF47 and 22CF118. Court reviews case. ADA Becker recites resolution. DE sworn. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty in case 22CF47 to Count 4: Battery (DOM)- 940.19(1) and Count 6: Criminal Damage to Property- 943.01(1). Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Counts 1-3,5, and 7 and 22CF118 . Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights.

22R 002491. $500.00 Posted by J.Gentry. arc

INCLUDES 22CF47 and 22CF118  

$1,000 on file

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug and ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cody M. Bui and Alexander S. Baillargeon or their residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may only have contact with minor child D.M.S, dob 7/8/17 when supervised by Lorina Simich.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
